Jason Rogers wrote:
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> 
>  > I thought I saw this pattern in your example:
>  >
>  > arrange
>  > act
>  > assert
>  > act some more
>  > assert some more
>  > act some more
>  > assert some more
>  >
> You are correct in that you "mis-saw".  It was:
> 
> arrange
> assert pre-conditions
> act
> assert post-conditions
> 
> The "assert pre-conditions" was only for the sake of clarity in the
> post.  This of course would have be done elsewhere (in a construction
> test) so that the testApplyCreditMemo() would not have needed to check it.

That's kind of the same thing. I used to do that. Now, I would write two 
tests:

1.
arrange
assert pre-conditions

2.
arrange
act
assert post-conditions

This is purely an instance of following the heuristic "Each test should 
test one thing at a time."
